title: Exercise: Detect Schema Drift with the SchemaScanner

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of schema drift?
options: A data integration workflow is failing more and more due to overwhelming data volumes.
An external partner's dataset used by your organization is overhauled and many of the attributes are renamed.
Different departments store the same dataset in different formats and cannot agree on which dataset should be the source of truth.
The average value of an attribute has gone up by an order of magnitude, and now your summary statistics report no longer makes sense.

questions.question: How could you also separately check for changes to data types in the schema?
options: Add a ChangeDetector_2 connected to the same ports as the ChangeDetector and set Selected Attributes to only fme_data_type.
Add a TestFilter and create tests for changed data types.
Add a TypeChangeDetector transformer after the ChangeDetector.
Add fme_data_type to the ChangeDetector Selected Attributes.
